Key Match Events: Mark Chapman’s swashbuckling half-century powered New Zealand to beat Pakistan by seven wickets in the third T20I of the five-match series.
Shadab Khan and Saim Ayub played blistering knocks to propel Pakistan to a formidable total against New Zealand.
New Zealand chased down Pakistan's total of 178/4 with a score of 179/3 in 18.2 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and elected to bowl first against Pakistan in the third T20I of the five-match series.
Others: Playing XIs: Pakistan: Babar Azam (c), Saim Ayub, Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Usman Khan, Iftikhar Ahmed, Muhammad Irfan Niazi, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Abbas Afridi, Abrar Ahmed. New Zealand: Michael Bracewell (c), Mark Chapman, Jacob Duffy, Zak Foulkes, Dean Foxcroft, Cole McConchie, James Neesham, Will O’Rourke, Tim Robinson, Tim Seifert, Ish Sodhi.
Head to Head: Matches 41, Pakistan 22, New Zealand 17, NR 2.
